task_summary: Place the held grid clamp onto the designated plate area and retreat safely.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed UR-type manipulator with a parallel gripper starts already holding a small grid clamp above a workboard with stacks of clamps and a metal plate area used as the placement site. The goal is to approach the plate, align precisely, descend until gentle contact, place the clamp, release it, and then retreat to a safe height. Movements should be deliberate with tight in-plane alignment and low contact force during touchdown to avoid toppling nearby stacks.
preconditions: Robot has the grid_clamp firmly grasped
Plate area on table is clear enough for placement
Workspace calibration and TCP are valid
Gripper operational and object pose stable
stepwise_plan: Verify the clamp is in the gripper
Move above the plate at safe height
Lower slowly until contact is detected
Retreat vertically to a safe distance
success_criteria: Clamp rests flat on the plate without sliding
No collision with nearby stacks or fixtures
Gripper fully opens and is empty after release
failure_and_recovery: If alignment fails, re-approach and realign
If contact not detected within depth, abort and retry from above
If object slips, stop and regrasp before placing
If obstruction detected, choose an alternate nearby spot on plate
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and retreat wait completes or upon unrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: gripper is centered and lowered near the target indicating start of the place-down motion
frame_3.predicts_next: release or further settling is expected immediately after

node_specs.description: Checks that the robot is holding the grid clamp before placing.
Move to a safe height above the plate placement area.
Align end-effector over the precise placement spot with tight tolerance.
Descend slowly until gentle contact is sensed to avoid impacts.
Perform the placing motion to rest the clamp on the plate.
Release the clamp by opening the gripper.
Back off vertically to a safe clearance after release.
Short pause to ensure stability before ending.

failure_modes: Misalignment over plate leading to topple
No contact detected within max depth
recovery_strategy: Re-run align and re-approach from above
Raise and try a new approach path
Verify grasp; if lost, abort to pick routine
assumptions: The clamp is already in the gripper at episode start
The placement target is the visible plate area near the stacks
Orientation required is vertical approach; no rotation changes needed
If instruction implied picking first, frames show only the placing phase and were prioritized

expected_success_criteria: Clamp rests flat and remains stationary on plate
End-effector at safe height at end
